intro: Cheilanthes tirajanae, commonly known as the Tiranha rock fern, is a species of fern that belongs to the Polypodiaceae family. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. This plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen rhizome and its ability to thrive in rocky and well-drained soils. The fronds are usually small, leathery, and have a distinctive, intricate venation pattern. Cheilanthes tirajanae is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient and hardy plant in its native habitat.
